comments:
Redhat 7.3 Sun JDK 1.3.1_03-b03 GTK version
After using Update Manager to upgrade from F2 to F3, I am unable to start
Eclipse.  Splash screen comes up and then disappears.  I have included the .log
file entry.  I upgraded by running as root.  After upgrade completed, I selected
to not immedietly restart Eclipse.  I shutdown Eclipse, and started it up as my
normal user.

I would be helpful if you still have 2 additional pieces of information 
(although I suspect by now this was deleted):

(1) content of /home/dwegener/workspace/.metadata/.config/ directory after the 
failed start
(2) what workspace were you using when you did the update as root, and the 
content of its .metadata/.config/ directory
Investigating as F4 candidate.
At this point the problem is not understood.

I have added thw files from the .config directories of my personal workspace and
the workspace I used to upgrade.  I had actually deleted the .config directory
from the upgrade workspace in an attempt to get the upgrade to succeed. 
However, that didn't seem to help the problem.  I then went to the Eclipse
install directory, removed Eclipse, and performed a fresh install of F3.  This
allowed me to bring up my personal workspace.  I don't think I have tried to
bring up the install workspace since the clean F3 install.

Prior to the F3 problem, I have used the Update manager at least 2 and possibly
3 times successfully.

Hopefully, these files are helpful to you.  I really like the Eclipse product
and am excited to see what is added next.

Dave Wegener
We have not been able to recreate the problem. Dropping from F4 but keeping 
defect open.

[side note: one of the F2 builds posted on the update server was bad (was 
missing help support). The history attached to the defect shows this build 
was installed. Missing Lucene plugin (part of help support) is the cause of the 
attached .log trace. The update plugin had help on its prereqs (this was bogus) 
which may have caused the reconciler to fail and incomplete configuration file 
written. Have removed the prereq on help].

Keeping defect open for further investigation.
A lot of bugs have been solved in this startup area. If you can reproduce it
with 2.0.2 please reopen with detailed description as I am not able to reproduce it
Thanks
